subject: thoughts to live by
verse: An angry man stirs up dissension, and a hot tempered one commits sins. A man's pride brings him low; but a man of lowly spirit gains honor. (Pro. 29:22-23) NIV
reflection: I don't know if everyone will agree with this, but to me it seems as though we live in an age of rage. Now by studying anger and its power, we can learn self-control so that we do not need to lose our temper in rage or abuse ourselves with resentment, but can defuse anger by resolving circumstances. We need to prayerfully seek how we can incorporate these resolutions in our own lives:. To keep my life centered on God, as best I can, recognizing that when I do not, my natural self will generate things to become angry about. . To not condemn myself for feelings of anger. . To do everything I can to avoid acting on the basis of anger. . To clean up any problems I create as quickly as possible. . To redirect the energy of anger away from hurting people and toward improving conditions for people. Every person who seeks God's help in the understanding and resolution of his or her anger will receive that help.
prayer: We need to pray for the miracle of God's love in us, the miracle of His redemptive grace. Amen.
original_content:
1/2/09 ~~~ Food for thought ~~~ Anger management...

Our Verses for Today:

An angry man stirs up dissension, and a hot tempered
one commits sins...

A man's pride brings him low; but a man of lowly spirit
gains honor...(Pro. 29:22-23) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

I don't know if everyone will agree with this, but to me it seems
as though we live in an age of rage...

Now by studying anger and its power, we can learn self-control
so that we do not need to lose our temper in rage or abuse
ourselves with resentment, but can defuse anger by resolving
circumstances...

We need to prayerfully seek how we can incorporate these resolutions
in our own lives:

. To keep my life centered on God, as best I can, recognizing
that when I do not, my natural self will generate things to become
angry about...

. To not condemn myself for feelings of anger...

. To do everything I can to avoid acting on the basis of anger...

. To clean up any problems I create as quickly as possible...

. To redirect the energy of anger away from hurting people and
toward improving conditions for people...

Every person who seeks God's help in the understanding and
resolution of his or her anger will receive that help...

Prayer for Today:
We need to pray for the miracle of God's love in us,
the miracle of His redemptive grace...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Cast all your anxiety on Him because He cares for you. (I Pet 5:7) Commit to the Lord whatever you do, and your plans will succeed. (Pro. 16:3) Do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. (Mt. 6:34)
reflection: Paul writes in Philippians "Do not be anxious." In one sense this is like telling a person with a bad head cold no to sniffle and sneeze. Or maybe its more like telling a wino to lay off the booze or a compulsive gambler to stay away from the casino. Is anxiety a disease or an addicition? Maybe it is something of both. Partly, perhaps, because you can't help it, and partly because for some dark reason you choose not to help it. How often do we torment ourselves with detailed visions of the worst that can possibly happen??? Now Paul does not try to minimize the fact that we will have some bad things happen to us. He certainly must have suspect that something bad would soon happen to him. He does not try to explain them away as God's will or God's judgment or God's method of testing our spiritual fiber. He simply tells us that in spite of them--even in the thick of them--we are to keep in touch with the One who transcends the worst things as He also transcends the best.
prayer: The best prayer in this case is ~~~ the 23 Psalm The Lord is my shepherd I shall not want. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When God created man, He made him in the likeness of God. Gen. 5:1 Yet, O Lord, You are our Father. We are the clay, You are the potter; we are all the work of Your hand. (Isa. 64:8)
reflection: The question we should ask ourselves today is: Do I have any joy in serving? Many people, yes even Christians, live only to make a good impression on others or to please themselves. BUT selfishness brings discord. Because of this Paul often stressed spiritual unity, asking us to love one another and to be of one spirit and purpose. If we remain mindful of the fact that we were all created in the likeness of God, we will attempt to work together, caring for the problems of others as if they were our problems. In doing so we will demonstrate Christ's example -- that of putting others first. In doing so we will experience unity. Let us not be so concerned about making a good impression or meeting our own needs that we strain our relationships in God's family.
prayer: Pray that you would be less concerned about material things yes even less concerned about self and more concerned about unity in the body of Christ. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I do everything through Him who gives me strength. (Phil. 4:13) If you remain in Me and My Words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be given to you. (Jn. 15:7) Praise be to the Lord, to God or Savior, who daily bears our burdens. (Ps. 68:18)
reflection: Some dear friends stopped by a couple of nights ago and we discussed different times in our lives when it was very evident that God had been in control of our life either saving us from near death, or someone whom we came into contact with. Because of this wonderful visit I was reminded of Lamentations 3:22-26 which has a very wonderful lesson for us. Because of the Lord's great love we are not consumed, for His compassion's never fail. They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness. I say to myself, "The Lord is my portion; therefore I will wait for Him." The Lord is good to those whose hope is in Him, to the one who seeks Him; It is good to wait quietly for the salvation of the Lord. I am reminded that the material things of this life, were never intended to posses my heart, that everything good is in another world and my only true treasure is Christ. Perhaps, by God's grace, I succeed, and for a day or two become a creature consciously dependent on God and drawing my strength from the right sources. But it seems that the moment a threat is withdrawn, my fleshly nature leaps back to my earthly treasures. It is then that the terrible necessity of tribulation is only to clear. my only real treasure must be Christ.
prayer: Lord help me to focus on my true treasure, Your Son, my Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I thought, "age should speak; advanced years should teach wisdom." But it is the spirit in a man, the breath of the Almighty, that gives him understanding. (Job 32:7, 8)
reflection: I'd like to share with you today what God's Word says about challenges. Lets look at what Eph. 6:10ff has to say in regards to challenges. Finally, be strong in the Lord and in His mighty power. Put on the full armor of God so that you can take your stand against the devils schemes. For your struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms. Therefore put on the full armor of God, so that when the day of evil comes, you maybe able to stand your ground. How does this relate to our lives today? First of all let us consider the brevity of our years on earth. This should cause us to find new motivations to preserve the values that will endure. Why should we work ourselves into an early grave, missing those precious moments with loved ones who crave our affection and attention? It is a question that every man and woman should consider. Let me leave you with this final word of encouragement for those who are determined to slow the pace: Once you get from under constant pressure, you'll wonder why you drove yourself so hard for those years. I have stood by many death beds and have yet to hear, "I wish I would have taken on more challenges and spent less time with friends and family."
prayer: We should always ask for a greater sensitivity to God's Spirit and a greater understanding of God's Word. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We also rejoice in our sufferings. because we know that suffering produces perseverance; perseverance, character; and character, hope. (Ro. 5:3-4)
reflection: How do we usually deal with trials in our life? I think it goes without saying that we prefer things to go smoothly in our life, with the least amount of valleys in our life. But of course we know that is wishful thinking, So let us look at some of the advantages that the Bible says about having trials. Lets look at James 1 beginning with verse 2 Dear brothers and sisters, whenever trouble comes your way, let it be an opportunity for joy. James doesn't say If trouble comes your way but whenever it does. James assumes that we will have troubles and that it is possible to profit from them. The point here is not to pretend to be happy when we face pain but to have a positive outlook (Let it be an opportunity for joy) verse 3, 4 goes on to say: For when your faith is tested, your endurance has a chance to grow. So let it grow, for when your endurance is fully developed, you will be strong in character. We can't fully know the depth of our character until we see how we react under pressure. It is easy to be kind and loveable towards others when everything is going well, but can we still be kind when others are treating us unfairly. The reason we have trials is that God wants to make us mature and complete, not to keep us from pain. Instead of complaining about our struggles, we should see them as opportunities to grow.
prayer: Instead of complaining let us thank God for promising to be with us in rough times. Ask God to help you solve your problems or to give you strength to endure them. Then be patient. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Whoever acknowledges Me before men, I will also acknowledge him before My Father in heaven. But whoever disowns Me before men, I will also disown him before My Father in Heaven. Mt. 10:32, 33
reflection: We may come on hard times but if we remain committed in our Christian walk, God will be there to carry us through the tough times. I would like to share a quote from Reggie White."The promises made, but not kept; the functions attended, but not experienced; the hopes dreamed, but not put into action -- commitment matters. There is no success for a football player -- or a Christian -- without it. Remember without commitment we cannot claim Jn. 14:6 I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me.
prayer: Let our prayers be that we will continue to walk in the Lord's will. Commitment to the Lord is the answer to eternity with Him. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Dear friends, do not be surprised at the painful trial you are suffering, as though something strange is happening to you. But rejoice that you participate in the suffering of Christ, so that you may be overjoyed when His glory is revealed. (I Pet. 4:12, 13)
reflection: It takes courage to look your spouse in the eye and say, "Our marriage is in serious trouble, and we have to do something about it." What do most people do? Well it is sad to say but most put their problems on the back burner and go their own directions. It also takes relational courage to build significant relationships with friends, to look another person in the eye and say, "Isn't it time we stopped talking about the weather and the stock market and start talking about what's going on in your life and mine? Isn't it time we became brothers?" Not many men have the courage to challenge each other, to fight for each other's spiritual and relational growth. But I have learned over the years that I will not be a success in my marriage, with my kids or with my friends, without courage.
prayer: Pray for the courage to share your feelings with family friends, and other acquaintances in humility. Be honest with God and He will give you courage and strength. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God is our refuge and strength, an ever present help in trouble. Therefore I will not fear, though the earth give way and the mountains fall into the heart of the sea, though its waters roar and foam and the mountains quake with their surging. (Ps. 46:1-3)
reflection: Life is always composed of those experiences and encounters which provide both challenges to ones character and the testing of one's spirit. In 1 Kgs. 19, I see a defeated and desolate Elijah sitting under a broom tree in the solitude of his own sadness. He had to ask life's most difficult question: "How did I get to where I am which is so far from where I am supposed to be?" If you haven't figured this out yet, let me tell you, there are only three kinds of people in the world: those who are in the wilderness, those who have just come in from the wilderness, and those who are headed into the wilderness. In the midst of Elijah's wilderness experience, God sent His angel to feed him."You don't have enough for your journey." "What journey" I'm through. I'm all washed up." "You're not through yet, Elijah. I'm going to send you from where you are to where I want you to be. I'm going to send you from the wilderness to the mountain." In the wilderness there is weakness, but on the mountain there is strength. In the wilderness there is loneliness, but on the mountain there is companionship. In the wilderness there is despair, but on the mountain there is hope. God has said, "I will never leave you or forsake you." So It is only because we do not recognize God's presence that we find ourselves in the wilderness. He wants to fellowship with us on the mountain.
prayer: Pray that you become more sensitive to God's presence so that you can have a mountain top experience with Him. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But whoever lives by the truth comes into the light, so that it may be seen plainly that what he has done has been done through God. Jn. 3:21 By this all men will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another. Jn. 13:35
reflection: The crossroads that we often face in our lives, IF we examine that closely are really spiritual crossroads. We have to decide whether or not we believe what the Bible says. All our decisions hang on that decision. It is important that our faith outweighs all our doubts. That decision will make an immediate difference in your life. It will surely transform you into a better person, even while you are yet learning. What that decision will do is readjust your priorities and give you a sense of confidence and peace about the future.
prayer: Pray that God will help you put Him first in your life and help you to readjust your priorities. Amen.
original_content:
1/13/09~~~food for thought)~~~Everyone who hears God's Word, 
needs to put them into practice...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

But whoever lives by the truth comes into the light,
so that it may be seen plainly that what he has done
has been done through God...Jn. 3:21

By this all men will know that you are my disciples,
if you love one another...Jn. 13:35

Our Lesson for Today:

The crossroads that we often face in our lives, IF we
examine that closely are really spiritual crossroads.

We have to decide whether or not we believe what the Bible says.
All our decisions hang on that decision. It is important that our
faith outweighs all our doubts...

That decision will make an immediate difference in your life.
It will surely transform you into a better person, even while you
are yet learning...

What that decision will do is readjust your priorities and give you
a sense of confidence and peace about the future...

Prayer suggestion:
Pray that God will help you put Him first in your life
and help you to readjust your priorities...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be men of courage; be strong. Do everything in love. (I Cor. 16:13, 14) Now this is what the Lord Almighty says: "Give careful thought to your ways." Haggai 1:5
reflection: I think that we all know many small men! Now I'm not talking about small in stature--but men who think little, talk little, plan little. they remind us of eagles staked to the ground, there's no soar to them. Their ceiling is zero--and their horizons are pulled in to the hub. I'm not saying that these men are selfish (some of course are). But it's just that they are preoccupied most of the time with their own little area of knowledge. They don't allow their minds to stretch and breathe. They don't think, they just rearrange their prejudices. These people are indifferent to problems other than their own. They have no concern for those things which do not hold a personal reference. They refuse to be bothered!!! We live in times which demand big men. Not men who are big shots (they're useless), but men who are big in heart and mind. Great men! Large-souled men! We need men with a vision--whose feet are on the ground, but whose eyes are on the far horizon. Men whose hearts God has touched. Men committed--dedicated to God and His holy and high purpose! Men of integrity!
prayer: Pray for wisdom--Godly wisdom. Pray for a Christ-like heart. pray for a sensitivity to God's purpose. Let us also pray for our leaders, that they also will be sensitive to God's will. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And this is the testimony: God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. (I Jn. 5:11) For God so loved the world that He gave His one and only Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish but have eternal life. (Jn. 3:16)
reflection: Let us give thanks for the assurance of eternal life! Because of our sinful flesh we could never deserve such an assurance, now knowing this we should be doubly grateful that He has given us the right to eternal life through union with His Son or Savior. Let us also give thanks that while we live in the world we can seek to serve Him fruitfully, and to praise Him by the kind of life we live, as well as by our lips.
prayer: Let us pray that the indwelling of His Spirit will ever keep before us the great privilege of being an heir of His glory, and a citizen of heaven. May our lives praise and worship Him in closest possible fellowship. Let us continue to worship and adore Him through Jesus Christ His Son. Let This Be Our Constant Prayer. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God will remain faithful, for He cannot disown Himself. 2 Tim. 2:14 The Lord is good, a refuge in times of trouble. He cares for those who trust in Him. Nahum 1:7
reflection: What do we do with our failures??? It would be a tragedy if my kids grew up knowing only that their dad was a good husband and father. If they thought I expected them to live every minute of their lives the way they have seen me live as they grew up, they would be frustrated and devastated if they failed. I want them to know what they didn't see, when I failed miserably and only came out of it by the grace of God. As they grow older and able to understand, I'm committed to being open and honest with them. I want them to know of my mistakes so they can avoid them. I also want them to know my mistakes because they will make their own, and I don't want them to feel they are the first person in the family to fail. I want to be able to sit with my kids and tell them some of the things I have done. Not to glorify sin. Not to justify it. Not to say everybody does it so it must be okay. Instead, because I'm not proud of it and because I don't want them to feel unique. Most of all, I want them to know that by the grace of God, He brought me through it and out of it, and He can do the same for them.
prayer: Pray that God will help you be honest and above board when your children ask questions about your walk through life. Pray that you will be able to share not only your victories, but also your failures. We need to pray for added grace. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Consequently, faith come from hearing the message, and the message is heard through the word of Christ. (Ro. 10:17) Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be men of courage; be strong. (1 Cor. 16:13)
reflection: God is perfect and we are not. We are just humans, and he is, well, God. So how can we relate to Him??? In the message of a pastor friend, he said Jesus is the answer. He said we could relate to Him because even though He was perfect, He had also become a man. He said Jesus was the bridge. And what this means is He paid for our sins. if we can accept that and believe in Christ, then we are forgiven and know we are going to heaven. Do you believe in God? Do you believe the Bible is God's message to man? Do you believe what the Bible says? That all have sinned? Do you want to become a Christian? If you have answered yes to this questions, then just pray. You may be asking: "How does one go about praying? Remember that God being God knows what's on your mind so, all you need to do is tell Him. If you have done that then you can step from skepticism to belief.
prayer: Just have a one to one conversation with God. You don't need to worry about fancy polished words. Just be sincere!!! Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For the Lord is good and His love endures forever; His faithfulness continues through all generations. (Ps. 100:5) Now it is required that those who have been given a trust must prove faithful. (1 Cor. 4:2)
reflection: Biblical friendship calls for faithfulness. Whatever our circumstances they should not affect our consistency. In Ro. 12:15 Paul says: we are to "rejoice with those who rejoice; mourn with those who mourn." Faithfulness is critical to a close relationship because we depend on those who are close to us. Christ's deepest hurts occurred within His circle of closest companions. David too was wounded emotionally more by the treachery of his close friends than by the efforts of his enemies (Ps. 55:12-14). Paul was also left to stand alone when he was deserted by Demas and others (2 Tim 4:10). A faithful friend keeps confidences. In Pro. we read that "A perverse man stirs up dissension, and a gossip separates close friends" (16:28). Entering friendship involves revealing yourself in confidence to another, thus becoming vulnerable. This is the way it should be, but at the same time it is what makes betrayal so evil and faithfulness so virtuous.
prayer: Pray that God would bridal your tongue from gossip and unloving words. Pray that you would always speak the most charitable words about others. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Whoever trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous will thrive like a green leaf. (Pro. 11:28) And my God will meet all your needs according to His riches in Christ Jesus. (Phil. 4:19)
reflection: Never settle for second-rate or selfish goals. set goals for yourself that involve helping other people and the riches will follow. The richest people I know are those who have given themselves unselfishly to other people. Such motivation will affect the way you sell, cook, teach or apply your particular trade. True riches, of course are totally unrelated to money or material reward. In fact, if a person has earned money without helping people, his money will not buy him happiness. Of one thing I am sure: happy people have strong goals, and somehow these include helping other people. They can also be assured that they will never run out of people to help.
prayer: Lets pray that we do not turn our backs on people less fortunate than we. Let us give thanks for those who helped us when we were in need, most of all thank God for these people and ask that He would bless them. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Blessed are they whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered. (Ro. 4:7) "I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more, " says the Lord. (Heb. 8:12) Help us, O God our Savior, for the glory of Your name; deliver us and forgive our sins for Your name's sake. (Ps. 79:9)
reflection: It has been said: "Forgiving is love's revolution against love's unfairness." Before you read any farther, reread the quote above. So basically what this is saying is: When we forgive, we ignore the normal laws that strap us to the natural laws of getting even. So I guess you could say is, by some magic of love, we release ourselves from our own painful past. So it has also been said that, "by being forgiving we fly over a dues-paying morality in order to create a new future out of the past's unfairness. So actually if this is true we free ourselves from the wrongs that were locked into our private histories. We unshackle our spirits from wrongful acts; and, maybe, if we are lucky, we also restore a relationship that would otherwise be lost forever. Yes there is a sort of "magic" in loving forgiveness.
prayer: Let us pray that God would restore or give us a loving, forgiving heart, so that all our relationships may be restored, thus also restoring a new relationship with Him. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: My intercessor is my friend as my eyes pour out tears to God. (Job 16:20) A perverse man stirs up dissension, and a gossip separates close friends. (Pro. 12:28)
reflection: One of the best examples of male friendship is found in the book of I Samuel. . Here we read about real male friendship, about a relationship that ran deep between Jonathan, the kings son and David, a shepherd boy and God's future choice for the throne. Their friendship was strong, it was built solidly on an inward attachment rather than on an outer attachment or social status. these men demonstrated a mutual acceptance of each other despite their different social backgrounds. David's interests were more important to Jonathan than his own, and David felt the same way about Jonathan's interests. If you take the time to study the friendship between David and Jonathan, you will come away with a good understanding of what a healthy friendship between men can and should have. Any definition of friendship should have the following: * Unconditional love * Personal enjoyment * Mutual acceptance * Mutual interests * Mutual commitment * Mutual loyalty What we should recognize here is that, friendship involves a concern for and involvement with the well-being of another person.
prayer: We should pray that the definitions laid out above would become a part of our character. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Christ died for us so that, whether we are awake or asleep, we may live together with Him. (I Thess. 5:10) Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me; Your rod and Your staff, they will comfort me. (Ps. 23:4)
reflection: The question today is: How much faith is enough in our mourning? I think that at one time or another we have all felt, it is more than we have. Jesus once said that the amount of faith isn't important. If we have faith, though it be as small as a mustard seed, nothing will be impossible. I see faith in this instant as basic trust. We don't need a huge amount of it in order to get on with our bereavement. In fact, if we worry about having a lot of faith, we may just miss the mustard seed we do have. Remember the giver of this grain of faith is God, whose Son maintained His faith. He went through His Gethsemane of grief with the word "Father" still on His lips. We too can go through the valleys and mountains of our bereavement journey with "Father" on our lips. Oh yes our hearts may wonder, doubt and cry out in pain, but these feelings will not obliterate our faith. Even when we think we have lost that mustard seed, we will do well to remember that our Father is faithful, for He has loved us first.
prayer: Pray for the courage to cling to the Father. Pray for a sensitivity to realize His presence. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Make every effort to live in peace with all men and to be holy; without holiness no one will see the Lord. (Heb. 12:14) But now that you have been set free from sin and have become slaves to God, the benefit you reap leads to holiness, and the result is eternal life. (Ro. 6:22)
reflection: What are your thoughts about God? How far have we drifted from the thought of His holiness??? I believe we need to recover a sense of awe and a profound reverence for God. We need to begin once again to view Him again in the infinite majesty that alone belongs to Him who is the Creator and Supreme Ruler of the entire universe. We seem to have forgotten that there in an infinite gap in worth and dignity between God the Creator and man the creature, even though man has been created in the image of God. The fear of God should be a heartfelt recognition of this gap, not a put down of man, but an exaltation of God. Sometimes I think that we have magnified the love of God almost to the exclusion of the fear of God. And because of this preoccupation we are not honoring God and reverencing Him as we should. We should be magnifying the love of God, BUT while we revel in His love and mercy, let us never lose sight of His majesty and His holiness.
prayer: Let us remember to approach God as a holy and just God. Let us remember to thank and praise Him for who He really is. Amen.
original_content:
Sat. 24/09~~~food for thought~~~God did not call us to be impure, but
to live a holy life...(1 Thess. 4:7)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Make every effort to live in peace with all men and to be holy;
without holiness no one will see the Lord...(Heb. 12:14)

But now that you have been set free from sin and have become 
slaves to God, the benefit you reap leads to holiness, and the
result is eternal life...(Ro. 6:22)

Our Lesson for Today:

What are your thoughts about God? How far have we drifted from
the thought of His holiness???

I believe we need to recover a sense of awe and a profound 
reverence for God. We need to begin once again to view Him
again in the infinite majesty that alone belongs to Him who is the
Creator and Supreme Ruler of the entire universe...

We seem to have forgotten that there in an infinite gap in worth 
and dignity between God the Creator and man the creature, even
though man has been created in the image of God...

The fear of God should be a heartfelt recognition of this gap,
not a put down of man, but an exaltation of God...

Sometimes I think that we have magnified the love of God almost
to the exclusion of the fear of God. And because of this preoccupation 
we are not honoring God and reverencing Him as we should...

We should be magnifying the love of God, BUT while we revel in His
love and mercy, let us never lose sight of His majesty and His holiness...

Prayer Suggestion:
Let us remember to approach God as a holy and just God.
Let us remember to thank and praise Him for who He really is...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see. (Heb. 11:1) Be strong and take heart, all you who hope in the Lord. (Ps. 31:24)
reflection: Most generally acts of hope expose themselves to ridicule because they seem impractical, failing to conform to visible reality. BUT in fact they are reality that is being constructed but is not yet visible. Hope is what commits us to actions that connect us with God. Often what we call hoping is often only wishing. We want things we think are impossible, but we have better sense than to spend money or commit our lives to them. Biblical hope, though, is an act. Hope acts on conviction that God will complete the work that He has begun even when the appearances, especially when the appearances, oppose it. Hope-determined actions participate in the future that God is bringing into being. However these acts are rarely spectacular. Usually they take place outside sacred settings. Hardly ever are they viewed to be significant by outsiders. It is not easy to act in hope because most of the immediate evidence is against it. Yes it takes courage to act in hope. But it is the only practical action that survives the decay of the moment.
prayer: Pray that your heart is set aside for Christ as Lord. Pray that you would always be ready to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give a reason for the hope that you have. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: May integrity and unrighteousness protect me, because my hope is in You. (Ps. 25:21) I strive always to keep my conscience clear before God and man. (Acts 24:16)
reflection: A father has to be careful of his promises, because a real man will follow through. A real man is a man of integrity, that means going all out in everything he does. When he says something, you can count on it, take it to the bank. If I say I'm going to do something, you can consider it done. The first time I violate that, my credibility is shot. Our reputations are only as good as our last performance. Unless the real men of this country, and there aren't many left, come together and align themselves under God, we're headed for catastrophe. God is looking for men who will obey and be what He wants them to be.
prayer: Dear Lord make it my ambition to lead a quiet life, to mind my own business and to work with my hands. Help me to keep all my promises to You and to my neighbor. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Be devoted to one another in brotherly love. Honor one another above yourselves. (Ro 12:10) Hatred stirs up dissension, but love covers over all wrong. (Pro. 10:12)
reflection: When Jesus was asked to name the greatest commandment in the Scriptures, He didn't hesitate in the least. He told the young Lawyer, "Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind. Love your neighbor as yourself." (Mt. 22:37, 39) Loving God, Loving others, and finding value in ourselves; without a doubt, these three aspects of love are the most effective weapons against the destructive power of low self-worth. Genuine love is a gift we give others. It isn't purchased by their actions or dependent upon our emotions at the moment. It may carry with it strong emotional feelings, but it isn't supported by them. Instead, it is a decision we make on a daily basis that someone is specail and valuable to us. In fact, love for someone often begins to flow once we have made a decision to honor them.
prayer: Pray for the fruit of the Spirit which is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, and faithfulness; because with these gifts will bloom Christ-likeness Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Blessed are the merciful, for they shall be shown mercy. (Mt. 5:7) The wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure; then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere. (Jm. 3:17)
reflection: Nothing expresses God's yearning to forgive better than the Book of Jonah. It contains only one line of prophecy: "Forty more days and Nineveh will be overturned." (3:4) BUT, to Jonah's disgust, that simple announcement of doom sparked a spiritual revival in Nineveh and changed God's plans for punishment. Jonah, sulking under a shriveled vine, admitted he had suspected God's soft heart all along. I believe this is the reason for the ocean storm, and how the whale detour came about. Yes I believe because Jonah could not trust God, could not, that is, trust Him to be harsh and unrelenting toward Nineveh. As Robert Frost summed up the story, "After Jonah, you could never trust God not to be merciful again."
prayer: Let it be a prayer of praise like that of, Micah 7:18 Who is a God like You, who pardons sin and forgives the transgression of the remnant of his transgression? You do not stay angry forever but delight in showing mercy. (Wow) Amen.
original_content:
Thur. 29/09~~~food for thought~~~Be merciful just as your Father (in heaven) 
is merciful...(Lk. 6:36)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Blessed are the merciful, for they shall be shown mercy...(Mt. 5:7)

The wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure;
then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of
mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere...(Jm. 3:17)

Our Lesson for Today:

Nothing expresses God's yearning to forgive better than the
Book of Jonah. It contains only one line of prophecy: "Forty
more days and Nineveh will be overturned." (3:4)

BUT, to Jonah's disgust, that simple announcement of doom
sparked a spiritual revival in Nineveh and changed God's plans 
for punishment...

Jonah, sulking under a shriveled vine, admitted he had suspected 
God's soft heart all along. I believe this is the reason for the ocean
storm, and how the whale detour came about. Yes I believe because
Jonah could not trust God, could not, that is, trust Him to be harsh 
and unrelenting toward Nineveh...

As Robert Frost summed up the story, "After Jonah, you could 
never trust God not to be merciful again."

Prayer Suggestion:
Let it be a prayer of praise like that of, Micah 7:18
Who is a God like You, who pardons sin and forgives the
transgression of the remnant of his transgression? You
do not stay angry forever but delight in showing mercy...

(Wow)

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When man's ways are pleasing to the Lord, He makes even his enemies live at peace with him. (Pro. 16:7) Make every effort to keep the unity of the Spirit through the bond of peace. (Eph. 4:3)
reflection: Someone once described the contrast between a good life and a godly life as the difference between the top of the ocean and the bottom. On top, sometimes it's like glass -- screen and calm -and other times it's raging and stormy. But hundreds of fathoms below, it is beautiful and consistent, always calm, always peaceful. Life around us in the world can go from one extreme to another, but if we have Christ deep down in our heart we can have peace.
prayer: Let us continue to pray that the Holy Spirit would help us in every effort to do what leads to peace and mutual edification. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: To God belong wisdom and power; counsel and understanding are His. (Job 12:13) God's wisdom is profound, and His power is vast. Who has resisted Him and come out unscathed? (Job 9:4)
reflection: What makes the temptation of power so seemingly irresistible? is it that, power offers an easy substitute for the hard task of love? It seems easier to be God than to love God, easier to control people than to love people, easier to own life that to love life. The long painful history of the church is the history of the people ever and again tempted to choose power over love, control over the cross, being a leader over being led. Those who have resisted this temptation are truly saints, and in the end give us hope.
prayer: Pray for the character of humility, love and grace. Amen.
